```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

library(tidyverse)
library(p8105.datasets)

set.seed(1)
```

```{r}
n_samp = 250

sim_df_const = 
  tibble(
    x = rnorm(n_samp, 1, 1),
    error = rnorm(n_samp, 0, 1),
    y = 2 + 3 * x + error
  )

sim_df_nonconst = sim_df_const %>% 
  mutate(
  error = error * .75 * x,
  y = 2 + 3 * x + error
)
sim_df = 
  bind_rows(const = sim_df_const, nonconst = sim_df_nonconst, .id = "data_source") 

sim_df %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = x, y = y)) + 
  geom_point(alpha = .5) +
  stat_smooth(method = "lm") +
  facet_grid(~data_source) 
```

```{r}
lm(y ~ x, data = sim_df_const) %>% 
  broom::tidy() %>% 
  knitr::kable(digits = 3)

lm(y ~ x, data = sim_df_nonconst) %>% 
  broom::tidy() %>% 
  knitr::kable(digits = 3)
```
## Bootstraping example

```{r}
boot_sample = function(df) {
  sample_frac(df, replace = TRUE)
}

# Replace = true means to sample with replacement
```

```{r}
boot_sample(sim_df_nonconst) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = x, y = y)) + 
  geom_point(alpha = .5) +
  stat_smooth(method = "lm")
```

Running multiple botstraps
```{r}
boot_straps = data_frame(
  strap_number = 1:1000,
  strap_sample = rerun(1000, boot_sample(sim_df_nonconst))
)

boot_straps %>% 
  filter(strap_number %in% 1:2) %>% 
  mutate(strap_sample = map(strap_sample, ~arrange(.x, x))) %>% 
  pull(strap_sample)

# Some people are over sampled and undersampled from the original 250 subjects
```

```{r}
boot_straps %>% 
  filter(strap_number %in% 1:3) %>% 
  unnest() %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = x, y = y)) + 
  geom_point(alpha = .5) +
  stat_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE) +
  facet_grid(~strap_number) 
```

```{r}
bootstrap_results = 
  boot_straps %>% 
  mutate(models = map(strap_sample, ~lm(y ~ x, data = .x) ),
         results = map(models, broom::tidy)) %>% 
  select(-strap_sample, -models) %>% 
  unnest() %>% 
  group_by(term) %>% 
  summarize(boot_se = sd(estimate))

bootstrap_results %>% 
  knitr::kable(digits = 3)
```

```{r}
boot_straps = 
  sim_df_nonconst %>% 
  modelr::bootstrap(n = 1000)
```

```{r}
sim_df_nonconst %>% 
  modelr::bootstrap(n = 1000) %>% 
  mutate(models = map(strap, ~lm(y ~ x, data = .x) ),
         results = map(models, broom::tidy)) %>% 
  select(-strap, -models) %>% 
  unnest() %>% 
  group_by(term) %>% 
  summarize(boot_se = sd(estimate))
```

```{r}
sim_df = 
  tibble(
    x = rnorm(25, 1, 1),
    error = rnorm(25, 0, 1),
    y = 2 + 3 * x + error
  )
```

```{r}
sim_df %>% 
  modelr::bootstrap(n = 1000) %>% 
  mutate(models = map(strap, ~lm(y ~ x, data = .x) ),
         results = map(models, broom::glance)) %>% 
  select(-strap, -models) %>% 
  unnest() %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = r.squared)) + geom_density()

# May not want to use datandard error of this distribution because it is not symmetric
```

```{r}
data("nyc_airbnb")

nyc_airbnb = 
  nyc_airbnb %>% 
  mutate(stars = review_scores_location / 2) %>% 
  rename(boro = neighbourhood_group,
         neighborhood = neighbourhood) %>% 
  filter(boro != "Staten Island") %>% 
  select(price, stars, boro, neighborhood, room_type)

nyc_airbnb %>% 
  filter(boro == "Manhattan") %>% 
  modelr::bootstrap(n = 1000) %>% 
  mutate(models = map(strap, ~ lm(price ~ stars + room_type, data = .x)),
         results = map(models, broom::tidy)) %>% 
  select(results) %>% 
  unnest() %>% 
  filter(term == "stars") %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = estimate)) + geom_density()
```
